Articles.Content:
hum.. I could argue with that...but it kind of makes sense... but can you explain then why the usa keeps buying new fighters?

The fact that every new fighter has different agility, mobility, stability, strength, speed and armament than the last.

why can't you ram anyway?

Watch Macey Deans video "Battle of Laythe" and you ll see why
almost forgot about that... but wouldn't firing a guided missle be ramming? because well it is a "ship"
Also @Spartwo i found the weak spot of the Bayonet: front and back.

almost forgot about that... but wouldn't firing a guided missle be ramming? because well it is a "ship"

Guided missiles are built specifically to fly into the enemy.
fighter can be too...I could all it a really really big missle that looks like my fighter..(i put a probe on it for a reason...)

fighter can be too...I could all it a really really big missle that looks like my fighter..(i put a probe on it for a reason...)

... i pioneered guided missiles. So as the saying goes "in Zokesia, Missile launches fighter!" because i built a two ton ship that carried a 2.5 ton missile.

new plan

1. get kerbal out of "missile"

2. go really fast at enemy with probe controls

3. ???

4. profit.

... i pioneered guided missiles. So as the saying goes "in Zokesia, Missile launches fighter!" because i built a two ton ship that carried a 2.5 ton missile.

I would've pioneered them if you hadn't already. I trademarked AND patented some though...I did pioneer the lanced missile though.

Edited October 8, 2013 by FallingIntoBlack

I would've pioneered them if you hadn't already. I trademarked AND patented some though...

Still

prepare for the Judgement Cannon

Still

prepare for the Judgement Cannon

The Judgement Cannon vs. the Helios and the Kingslayer. That'll be...interesting.
The most familiar shape in the universe...

The most familiar shape in the universe...

Because everyone's ships look exactly like that from the front.

Because everyone's ships look exactly like that from the front.

Now you'd best hope its not the most familiar shape in the universe, because it has MY weapons, and you'd best hope that they're not pointed at you.

Hehe, I can make moderately good ships, but my weapons are all based off of unproven concepts... so it provides quite a mixed bag of results. I should actually try to create a series of weapons now... .

I had a few experiments, like the dual stage skirmish missile... which turned out to be quite effective. Another one was a mine, which fired only after targets came into range during loitering. Should I include them in my ships? (My ships are nowhere as good as some of the others you guys made... .)

Edited October 8, 2013 by andrew123
So about the Ramming rule, we can't ram, but can we have ships with claw-like parts that, by going fast along the hull of an enemy, scrape off loose/damage armor/components?

So about the Ramming rule, we can't ram, but can we have ships with claw-like parts that, by going fast along the hull of an enemy, scrape off loose/damage armor/components?

That is literally the definition of ramming.

To clarify the rule, perhaps a missile should be no more than a certain percentage of its mother ship's tonnage.

Ah well. I've never been an armor guy. Weapons Officer is my specialty.

The Drek XIII. Now deadlier than ever. Comes with tow Helios Torpedoes (by FallingIntoBlack), guaranteed kill at 500m.

You're using a reasonable amount of fuel,are you ok?

You're using a reasonable amount of fuel,are you ok?

actually it still is too low, only like 900m/s D/V. Ive found the drek keeps breaking its back because it's too long, trying to widen it a bit.
so make a tug thing for it
